description: Unique identifier for the asset type configuration record.

Human-readable name or description of the asset category represented by this type.
Indicates participation in a baseline MRF process (meaning of MRF likely maintenance/repair form; confirm with SME).
Indicates whether assets of this type track an expiration date.
Marks this asset type as inactive for new asset creation.
Indicates whether individual assets of this type can be scheduled or assigned.
Enables the second oil-related attribute for this asset type.
Enables the first oil-related attribute for this asset type.
Enables oil tracking for assets of this type.
Enables the second fuel-related attribute for this asset type.
Enables the first fuel-related attribute for this asset type.
Enables fuel tracking for assets of this type.
Indicates assets of this type can be attached to another asset (e.g., trailer to vehicle).
Enables condition tracking for assets of this type.
Flags this asset type as a tool or portable item.
Enables downtime cost tracking for assets of this type.
Enables the third custom type attribute.

Enables the first custom type attribute.
Enables the set of custom type attributes for this asset type.

Enables tracking of vehicle identification number.

Displays required certifications or compliance items on asset records of this type.
Displays or requires an asset image on records of this type.
Displays a storage location field for assets of this type.
Indicates physical location tracking is enabled for this asset type.
Marks this as a fleet-managed asset type.
Enables tracking of model information for assets of this type.
Enables tracking of gross vehicle weight for this asset type.
Enables tracking of occupancy/capacity for this asset type.

Enables tracking of manufacture or model year.

Includes the year in the auto-generated asset description.
Default inspection template used when transferring an asset of this type.
Reference source for the transfer inspection template (lookup table; confirm with SME).
Default inspection template used during initial asset setup.
Reference source for the setup inspection template (lookup table; confirm with SME).
Default work code applied when a new asset of this type is created.
Reference source for the default work code (lookup table; confirm with SME).
Default status assigned to newly created assets of this type.
Reference source for the status values used for new assets.
Behavioral class for this asset type (e.g., consumable vs. physical asset); confirm categories with SME.
Default unit or metric used by the fourth meter for this type.
Default unit or metric used by the third meter for this type.
Default unit or metric used by the second meter for this type.
Default unit or metric used by the primary meter for this type.
Meter tracking configuration indicator (e.g., none, single, multiple); exact codes vary by system; confirm with SME.
Subclassification for facility-related assets or flag when not applicable; confirm with SME.
Fields included when auto-generating the asset description for this type.
Method or template code used to build asset descriptions.
Code controlling inclusion and order of make and model in asset descriptions.
Code controlling inclusion of year in asset descriptions.
Code controlling inclusion of category in asset descriptions.
Field used as the primary identifier within generated descriptions.
High-level asset family this configuration represents (e.g., vehicle, equipment, facility).
Identifier from a legacy source system for cross-reference or migration.
Name of the legacy source table associated with the legacy identifier.

Reference source for the default inspection template (lookup table; confirm with SME).
